isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS DT 466 and DT 530 - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS - Low Injection Control Pressure Test

entry.para: Do this Test 13 if ICP was low during Test 9 or 12.
• Remove EOT sensor, check for oil in reservoir (oil should pour out). Reinstall EOT sensor. See figure H on back of form.
• Remove high pressure hose from oil manifold.
• Attach adapter ZTSE4359 and ICP sensor to hose.
• If ICP meets specs, check for high pressure oil leakage under the valve cover.
• If ICP is low check for pump rotation.
• If ICP is still low replace IPR and retest.

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To find the cause of low ICP pressure that prevents engine from starting.

note.para: If DTC's were detected previously, the problems causing the DTC's should be repaired before performing this test.

step1.para: Remove engine harness connector from Engine Oil Temperature (EOT) sensor on left rear of front cover.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, be certain that the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is applied, and drive wheels are blocked prior to cranking engine.

step1.para: Remove EOT sensor from the front cover . Oil should pour out. If oil level is low, crank engine and recheck level. If level does not increase, lube oil pump may not be supplying the proper amount of oil to the reservoir. If the oil level was above the EOT sensor, reinstall the sensor and go to the next step.

figure.caption: Checking Oil Level in Oil Reservoir

step1.para: Disconnect high pressure oil hose from the high pressure oil manifold and install the adapter from Hydraulic Fitting Kit into the end of the high pressure hose .

note.para: An alternative method would be to install another ICP sensor into the adapter and hose leaving the original ICP sensor in place.

step1.para: Disconnect ICP sensor engine harness connector and remove ICP sensor.
Install ICP sensor adapter into end of the high pressure oil hose.

note.para: If the EST is to be used for measuring ICP pressure, reconnect ICP engine harness connector to ICP sensor. Monitor and record ICP pressure while cranking engine.
If the EST is unavailable follow the remaining steps outlined below.

step1.para: Install ICP Breakout Tee ZTSE4347 between the ICP sensor and ICP engine harness connector.
Connect (+) lead of the Digital Multimeter (DMM) to green terminal and the (-) lead to black terminal of the Breakout Tee.
Monitor ICP pressure (signal voltage) while cranking engine and record on diagnostic form.

If ICP pressure is greater than 500 psi or 1 volt, go to ICP Leakage Test. If ICP pressure is less than 500 psi or 1 volt, do the following. Install a breakout tee and measure voltage at red pin. Voltage should be 12 ± 0.5V. Ground the green pin to the chassis ground while cranking. If pressure is above 500 psi or 1V refer to IPR Diagnostics in Section 3. If pressure is still low proceed with the following steps.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, be certain that the transmission is in neutral, parking brake is applied, and drive wheels are blocked prior to cranking engine.

item.para: Remove fuel transfer pump on the housing.

Crank the engine and check rotation of the fuel transfer pump camshaft inside the housing. If camshaft is not rotating, remove high pressure pump and tighten drive gear. Reinstall high pressure pump. Recheck ICP pressure while cranking engine.
If pressure is low, replace IPR valve and recheck ICP pressure.
If pressure is still low, replace high pressure oil pump.

svcsubproc.title: ICP Leakage Test

step1.para: Remove ICP sensor and adapter plug (used previously) from high pressure hose. Reattach hose to oil manifold. Remove the other end of the hose from the high pressure pump and connect an air pressure regulator to the (removed) hose as shown in the illustration ICP Leakage Test .
Apply 100 psi to the oil manifold.
Inspect for leakage around the base of each fuel injector.

svcsubproc.para: If an injector leaks, remove and inspect injector for damage or worn O-rings.

If injectors do not leak, perform a Key-On Engine-Off Injector Test with air pressure still applied. Check oil discharge from each injector. Oil discharge should be equal. Excess oil leakage indicates defective fuel injectors.
To find injector leaks, remove air supply and regulator from the high pressure hose and follow the procedure below.

item.para: Connect an automotive cylinder leak testerto the high pressure hose and apply air pressure from the cylinder leak tester.
Conduct an Key-On Engine-Off Injector Test to determine the percent of cylinder leakage for each actuated injector. Remove and inspect injectors showing the most leakage.
If none of the injectors have excessive leakage, remove all injectors. Inspect all O-rings for wear and damage. Replace faulty O-rings.
If oil entered the fuel system, drain fuel tank(s) of contaminated fuel.

svcsubproc.title: Possible Causes
svcsubproc.para: Low injection pressure (voltage) indicates low oil pressure to the injectors. This may be caused by

item.para: No oil in engine
Oil reservoir leak (possibly through check valve for the high pressure pump)
Cracked or porous cylinder head
Cracked or porous fuel/oil manifold
Defective high pressure pump
Injector O-ring leak
Injector body leak
Internal leakage of HEUI injector
IPR valve stuck open
Pump drive gear loose or damaged
Faulty lube oil pump unable to fill reservoir
Faulty IPR wires
Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software
ICP adapter fitting from Hydraulic Fitting Kit (ZTSE4359)
DMM (ZTSE4357) (optional)
ICP sensor Breakout Tee (ZTSE4347)(optional)
If DTC's are set, see DTC column on Engine Diagnostic Trouble Codes .
